ch.lambdaj.function.argument

Class ArgumentsFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.lambdaj.function.argument.ArgumentsFactory

  • public final class ArgumentsFactory
extends Object
    An utility class of static factory methods that creates arguments and binds them with their placeholders
    Author:
    Mario Fusco

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Converts a placeholder with the actual argument to which is bound

      Enable or disable the JIT optimization of lambdaj's arguments.

    • Method Detail

      • enableJitting

        public static void enableJitting(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable the JIT optimization of lambdaj's arguments. Disabled by default
        Parameters:
        enable - True to enable the JIT optimization, false to disable it

      • createArgument

        public static <T> T createArgument(Class<T> clazz)
        Constructs a proxy object that mocks the given Class registering all the subsequent invocations on the object.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the object to be mocked
        Returns:
        An object of the given class that register all the invocations made on it

      • actualArgument

        public static <T> Argument<T> actualArgument(T placeholder)
        Converts a placeholder with the actual argument to which is bound
        Parameters:
        placeholder - The placeholder used to retrieve a registered argument
        Returns:
        The argument bound to the given placeholder

      • createClosureArgumentPlaceholder

        public static <T> T createClosureArgumentPlaceholder(Class<T> clazz)
        Creates a placeholder of the given class for a non-bound closure argument
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the placeholder
        Returns:
        A placeholder of the given class

      • placeholderToClosureArgument

        public static <T> Argument<T> placeholderToClosureArgument(T placeholder)

        Register a custom argument creator factory for an unknown final class
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class for which this factory should be used
        creator - The argument factory
